docs.lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner will face lawmakers who are less than pleased by key elements of the sweeping financial regulatory plan he helped develop. With serious concerns about the administration's plan coming from Congressional leaders and financial institutions, it's bound to be yet another long day on Capitol Hill for Mr. Geithner.
docs.abstract: Congress begins its review of the president's new proposals for overseeing the nation's financial institutions.
docs.snippet: Congress begins its review of the president's new proposals for overseeing the nation's financial institutions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Edward M. Kennedy, the chairman of the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee, may have no closer Republican friend than Senator Orrin Hatch, of Utah, who served as chairman of the committee for much of the 1980s and is a longtime partner with Mr. Kennedy on numerous bills.

headline.main: Hatch, Friend of Kennedy, Warns Democrats on Health Care

docs.abstract: The senator from Utah chides members on a Senate panel for rushing legislation without a bipartisan agreement.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last week, Economix ran a post by Jonathan Skinner, a Dartmouth economist, responding to criticism of the Dartmouth Health Atlas -- which has found that regions spending more money on medical care don't have better results.
docs.abstract: Amitabh Chandra, a Harvard economist, takes on critics of the Dartmouth Health Atlas and its analysis of geographic variations in medical spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: With President Obama set late this afternoon to sign a new policy permitting many benefits to be extended to the same-sex partners of federal employees, the White House has issued a brief fact sheet with a few details.
